AbstractAdminObject_mxJPO
public class AbstractAdminObject_mxJPO.PadSaxHandler
extends DefaultHandler

SAX handler used to parse the XML exports from XML.

Field Detail

stack

private final Stack<String> stack
Holds the current stack (deep) of the tags. If a start element from startElement(String, String, String, Attributes) is called a new string is added. If an evaluation of an element is ended from endElement(String, String, String), this element is removed from the stack.

See Also:
getUrl(), startElement(String, String, String, Attributes), endElement(String, String, String)

content

private StringBuilder content
Holds the string content within a XML tag. The content is build by characters(char[], int, int) and reset by startElement(String, String, String, Attributes).

See Also:
characters(char[], int, int)

evaluated

private boolean evaluated
Holds a flag if evaluate() already called for an element. If not, the value is false. The value is always reset if an element is started in startElement(String, String, String, Attributes).

See Also:
startElement(String, String, String, Attributes), endElement(String, String, String)
Constructor Detail

AbstractAdminObject_mxJPO.PadSaxHandler

public AbstractAdminObject_mxJPO.PadSaxHandler()
Method Detail

resolveEntity

public InputSource resolveEntity(String _publicId,
                                 String _systemId)
An input source defining the entity "ematrixProductDtd" to replace the original DTD file "ematrixml.dtd" which some XML parser wants to open.

Specified by:
resolveEntity in interface EntityResolver
Overrides:
resolveEntity in class DefaultHandler
Parameters:
_publicId - not used
_systemId - not used
Returns:
input source where only the "ematrixProductDtd" entity is defined

characters

public void characters(char[] _ch,
                       int _start,
                       int _length)
Adds given characters to content if the XML element was not already evaluated (checked with flag evaluated).

Specified by:
characters in interface ContentHandler
Overrides:
characters in class DefaultHandler
Parameters:
_ch - array of characters
_start - start position within the array of characters
_length - length of characters within the array of characters
See Also:
content

startElement

public void startElement(String _uri,
                         String _localName,
                         String _qName,
                         Attributes _attributes)
A definition of a XML element is started. If previous XML element was not evaluated, previous XML element is evaluated by calling evaluate(). Current XML element is then added to the stack.

Specified by:
startElement in interface ContentHandler
Overrides:
startElement in class DefaultHandler
Parameters:
_uri - URI of the XML element (not used)
_localName - local name of the XML element (not used)
_qName - current name of the XML element
_attributes - attributes of the XML element (not used)
See Also:
stack, evaluated, evaluate()

endElement

public void endElement(String _uri,
                       String _localName,
                       String _qName)
A definition of a XML element is ended. If the XML element is not already evaluated (checked with flag evaluated), current XML element is evaluated by evaluate(). The XML element is removed from stack.

Specified by:
endElement in interface ContentHandler
Overrides:
endElement in class DefaultHandler
Parameters:
_uri - URI of the XML element (not used)
_localName - local name of the XML element (not used)
_qName - current name of the XML element (not used)
See Also:
stack, evaluated, evaluate()

getUrl

private String getUrl()
Prepares an URL from current stack. The URL is build starting with third element of the stack. The first three elements are defined only for administration purpose.

Returns:
URL made from stack
See Also:
stack

evaluate

private void evaluate()

Current XML element is evaluated. The path of the element defined by the stack fetched from getUrl() is used to identify the XML element. Evaluation of a XML element means to call AbstractAdminObject_mxJPO.parse(String, String).

The parser is only called if the deep of a XML element is higher than two, because this XML tags defines the administration element. Deep 0 till 2 is used from MX for administration.

See Also:
stack
